title: What is the difference between checked and unchecked exceptions?

answers.junior: Checked exceptions must be caught or declared. Unchecked exceptions don't need to be. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: Checked exceptions extend Exception, require compile-time handling. Unchecked exceptions extend RuntimeException, optional handling. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Use checked for recoverable conditions.
